question: Which are the only three navigable waterway-passages, around South America, between the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean?
option1: Beagle Channel, Strait of Magellan and Drake Passage
option2: English Channel, Strait of Gibraltar and Drake Passage
option3: Beagle Channel, Strait of Hormuz and Drake Passage
option4: Corscia Channel, Strait of Magellan and Drake Passage
answer: Beagle Channel, Strait of Magellan and Drake Passage
explanation: Beagle Channel, Strait of Magellan and Drake Passage are the only three navigable waterway-passages around South America connecting the Atlantic Ocean and the Pacific Ocean. However, most of the commercial shipping prefer to use the open-ocean Drake Passage for the conveyance between the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean.
